New Records: Myles Turner recorded his seventh career game with 30+ points and 10+ rebounds.
Tyrese Haliburton extended his double-double streak to four games with 45 assists and 6 turnovers.
Luka Doncic recorded his first game with 10+ assists.
Key Match Events: The Pacers went on an 8-0 run late in the game to secure the victory.
Myles Turner delivered a crucial three-pointer with Luka Doncic defending.
The game was closely contested, with the Pacers winning by a margin.
Pre-Game Insights: The Pacers were without Isaiah Jackson (torn achilles) and Aaron Nesmith (sprained left ankle), with Bennedict Mathurin starting for the second consecutive game.
The Pacers had a strong first quarter, leading 36-29 after twelve minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana has won five of the last six meetings in Dallas under Rick Carlisle.
The Pacers' performance in Dallas has been significant.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the Pacers' third win in Dallas since returning in 2021.
Indiana has won the rebounding margin in all seven games this season.
Others: The game was the 100th meeting between the two rival teams.
